update.description: There have been some behavior changes in sdf 1.7, which causes sdformat9 DOM objects to fail to load sdf 1.6 files. This pull request stores the original version of the SDF document that was parsed, so that downstream users can handle errors differently based on the version of the original SDF document. The `OriginalVersion()` accessor and `SetOriginalVersion(string)` functions are added to `sdf::Element` and `sdf::SDF` and set during parsing similar to the way `SetFilePath` is called.
update.title: Access the original parsed version of an SDF document with `Element::OriginalVersion`

content.raw:
Yeah, that's a valid concern. Another option is to clear the `filePath` and `originalVersion` in 

* `bool readString(const std::string &_xmlString, ElementPtr _sdf, Errors &_errors)`
* `bool readFile(const std::string &_filename, SDFPtr _sdf, Errors &_errors)`
* `bool readString(const std::string &_xmlString, SDFPtr _sdf, Errors &_errors)`

I think it would be safe to do. I can't think of a usecase where calling any of these functions should not reset those variables.
content.html:
Yeah, that's a valid concern. Another option is to clear the filePath and originalVersion in

  • bool readString(const std::string &_xmlString, ElementPtr _sdf, Errors &_errors)
  • bool readFile(const std::string &_filename, SDFPtr _sdf, Errors &_errors)
  • bool readString(const std::string &_xmlString, SDFPtr _sdf, Errors &_errors)

I think it would be safe to do. I can't think of a usecase where calling any of these functions should not reset those variables.

content.raw: I can't say why `SDF::SetFilePath` doesn't work that way. Maybe @{557058:6ff86fcb-b7ab-44a5-b8a6-f6d9cae8b6e8} can weigh in. IMO, if the SDFPtr and its root ElementPtr should always have the same `filePath` and `originalVersion`, it would make sense to set them in one place to reduce the chance of setting one and forgetting to set the other.
content.html: I can't say why SDF::SetFilePath doesn't work that way. Maybe @Louise Poubel can weigh in. IMO, if the SDFPtr and its root ElementPtr should always have the same filePath and originalVersion, it would make sense to set them in one place to reduce the chance of setting one and forgetting to set the other.

However, just for clarity, I would suggest adding a function called Clear that calls ClearElements and also clears originalVersion and path.

content.raw:
I think I have addressed this concern:

* 1e44abe: `Element::ClearElements` now clears original version and file path as well
* 13f1dde: added `SDF::Clear` that calls `ClearElements` on its `Root()` and clears the `SDFPtr`'s original version and file path
* 06fa0e4: added a modified version of your test that calls `sdf->Clear()` instead of `sdf->Root()->ClearElements()`
content.html:
I think I have addressed this concern:

  • 1e44abe: Element::ClearElements now clears original version and file path as well
  • 13f1dde: added SDF::Clear that calls ClearElements on its Root() and clears the SDFPtr's original version and file path
  • 06fa0e4: added a modified version of your test that calls sdf->Clear() instead of sdf->Root()->ClearElements()

content.raw:
> Another option could be to not permit reading into an SDF DOM object that’s already been read into?

I'm not sure I'd call `sdf::SDF` a DOM object. It's a type lower in the abstraction hierarchy used before DOM objects are created. It is also used directly in Gazebo classic to read in sdf files. Not permitting reuse could potentially require significant changes in Gazebo.
content.html:
Another option could be to not permit reading into an SDF DOM object that’s already been read into?

I'm not sure I'd call sdf::SDF a DOM object. It's a type lower in the abstraction hierarchy used before DOM objects are created. It is also used directly in Gazebo classic to read in sdf files. Not permitting reuse could potentially require significant changes in Gazebo.

pullrequest.title: Access the original parsed version of an SDF document with `Element::OriginalVersion`

content.html:
I found a use case where the result is somewhat unexpected. This following test fails because the version string in sdf::SDF or sdf::Element is not overwritten once it has been set, so it can't be reused to read in a different file. I have seen code in Gazebo and libsdformat where sdf::SDF is reused because instantiating a new one can is expensive. 

diff --git a/src/parser_TEST.cc b/src/parser_TEST.cc
--- a/src/parser_TEST.cc
+++ b/src/parser_TEST.cc
@@ -99,2 +99,25 @@ TEST(Parser, readFileConversions)
 /////////////////////////////////////////////////
+TEST(Parser, ReusedSDFVersion)
+{
+  std::string pathBase = PROJECT_SOURCE_PATH;
+  pathBase += "/test/sdf";
+  const std::string path17 = pathBase +"/model_link_relative_to.sdf";
+  const std::string path16 = pathBase +"/joint_complete.sdf";
+
+  // Call readFile API that always converts
+  sdf::SDFPtr sdf = InitSDF();
+  EXPECT_TRUE(sdf::readFile(path17, sdf));
+  EXPECT_EQ("1.7", sdf->Root()->Get<std::string>("version"));
+  EXPECT_EQ("1.7", sdf->OriginalVersion());
+  EXPECT_EQ("1.7", sdf->Root()->OriginalVersion());
+
+  sdf->Root()->ClearElements();
+
+  EXPECT_TRUE(sdf::readFile(path16, sdf));
+  EXPECT_EQ("1.7", sdf->Root()->Get<std::string>("version"));
+  EXPECT_EQ("1.6", sdf->OriginalVersion());
+  EXPECT_EQ("1.6", sdf->Root()->OriginalVersion());
+}
+
+/////////////////////////////////////////////////
 TEST(Parser, NameUniqueness)

content.raw:
the values are passed on in the same way the the file path is passed during `Element::SetParent` (see Element.cc diff)

this gets called during [readXml from parser.cc](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/f1ffc1a1b42c86b8c7a18e223cf70e868b1207a0/src/parser.cc#lines-721:972) when parsing elements during the initial pass, so it doesn't have to do an extra recursion to set the values
content.html:
the values are passed on in the same way the the file path is passed during Element::SetParent (see Element.cc diff)

this gets called during readXml from parser.cc when parsing elements during the initial pass, so it doesn't have to do an extra recursion to set the values

content.raw:
The `convertFile` and `convertString` functions let you specify which version to convert to (`_version`); the `readFile` and `readString` functions both convert only to the latest version. Without this code block in the `convert*` functions that calls `SDF::SetOriginalVersion` and `recursiveElementSetOriginalVersion`, the original version will be set to `_version`, even though that's really the version after conversion.

I'm not sure which function could take a flag that would fix this.
content.html:
The convertFile and convertString functions let you specify which version to convert to (_version); the readFile and readString functions both convert only to the latest version. Without this code block in the convert* functions that calls SDF::SetOriginalVersion and recursiveElementSetOriginalVersion, the original version will be set to _version, even though that's really the version after conversion.

I'm not sure which function could take a flag that would fix this.
